pr_title: Output msg when is beta release

timeline.message: Output msg when is beta release

timeline.bodyText: Should it say "WebSphere Liberty"? It might be Open Liberty? Is there a way to dynamically put the product name in? There must be some precedent.
timeline.author: tevans78
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -704,6 +704,10 @@ error.missing.version.files=CWWKE0952E: Version information cannot be read from
 error.missing.version.files.explanation=The directory that contains version information files either does not exist or cannot be read by the current user.
 error.missing.version.files.useraction=Ensure that the directory exists and can be read by the current user. 
 
+warning.earlyRelease=CWWKE0953W: This is an unsupported early release version of WebSphere Liberty.

replies.bodyText:
Message is changed to:    This version of {0} is an unsupported early release version.
The way I have it now it gets the product name from the lib/versions/xxxx.properties files.   If there is an openliberty.properties and a WebSphereApplicatonServer.properties and both are set to EARLY_ACCESS, then you get 2 messages:
Starting server defaultServer.
CWWKE0953W: This version of Open Liberty is an unsupported early release version.
CWWKE0953W: This version of WebSphere Application Server is an unsupported early release version.
Server defaultServer started with process ID 66213.
I don't know if both properties files always agree on whether it is an EARLY_ACCESS edition.
replies.author: jimblye

replies.bodyText: I'm sure they do both use EARLY_ACCESS... if not that's a different bug!
replies.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: I don't think it matters if the message is output twice on WebSphere Liberty ... this is a beta anyway
replies.author: tevans78

timeline.bodyText:
What about updating it to:

This version of Open Liberty is an unsupported early release version.

Assuming that we switch it to Open Liberty.
timeline.author: Charlotte-Holt
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -704,6 +704,10 @@ error.missing.version.files=CWWKE0952E: Version information cannot be read from
 error.missing.version.files.explanation=The directory that contains version information files either does not exist or cannot be read by the current user.
 error.missing.version.files.useraction=Ensure that the directory exists and can be read by the current user. 
 
+warning.earlyRelease=CWWKE0953W: This is an unsupported early release version of WebSphere Liberty.

replies.bodyText: done.   This version of {0} is an unsupported early release version.
replies.author: jimblye

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested update:

Do not use an early release version on production systems, since early release versions are not supported.
timeline.author: Charlotte-Holt
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -704,6 +704,10 @@ error.missing.version.files=CWWKE0952E: Version information cannot be read from
 error.missing.version.files.explanation=The directory that contains version information files either does not exist or cannot be read by the current user.
 error.missing.version.files.useraction=Ensure that the directory exists and can be read by the current user. 
 
+warning.earlyRelease=CWWKE0953W: This is an unsupported early release version of WebSphere Liberty.
+warning.earlyRelease.explanation=New features that are not fully tested are made available in early releases to elicit feedback before they are included in a supported release.
+warning.earlyRelease.useraction=Do not use an early release version on production systems, since it is not supported.

timeline.message: Output message when is beta Take-2
